item.title: Airwolf Interview - Gary A. Lee
item.author: info@airwolf.tv (The Wolf's Lair magazine)
item.itunes:author: The Wolf's Lair magazine
item.itunes:subtitle: An interview with Airwolf Art Director Gary A. Lee.
item.itunes:summary: For two seasons Gary Lee helmed the Airwolf art department, at first working hand-in-hand with Production Designer Charles Davis, then taking over after the first three episodes. This interview features his answers to follow-up questions from fans that are related to his story as told in issue #2 of The Wolf's Lair magazine. Among many subjects, he discusses working at the studio, budgeting, scripts, optical process techniques such as green screen, the Hawke's cabin set, working with Directors as well as the difference between working in television and film. He also discusses memories of working on other productions, including "Showgirls," "Home Alone," "Million Dollar Baby" and "Flags of our Fathers," where he takes extra time to relate what it's like to work with and for Clint Eastwood. Interview conducted by series historian Clark Van Hoten.
